item.title: NASA’s close encounter with Sun! Parker Solar Probe to make historic flyby of star’s surface on Christmas Eve - The Financial Express
item.description:
NASA’s Parker Solar Probe to Make Historic Flyby of the Sun's Surface on Christmas Eve

Publication Date: December 24, 2024

Source: NASA

The Parker Solar Probe is set to achieve a historic milestone this Christmas Eve by flying closer to the Sun than any previous human-made object.

  • The spacecraft will pass just 3.8 million miles from the Sun’s surface during its 22nd close approach.
  • Currently the fastest human-made object, moving at 430,000 miles per hour.
  • Aims to explore why the Sun’s corona is significantly hotter than its surface.
  • Equipped with a specialized heat shield to withstand temperatures of around 1,800°F.
  • Data collection will begin shortly after the flyby, with updates provided by NASA.
  • The mission will continue with more flybys planned in the coming years.
“By studying the Sun from such close proximity, the Parker Solar Probe is poised to answer long-standing questions about solar activity.”

This flyby is a landmark achievement in solar exploration and will enhance our understanding of space weather and its impact on Earth.

item.title: Anti-Pollution Measures (GRAP-4) Revoked In Delhi As Air Quality Improves - NDTV
item.description:
Anti-Pollution Measures (GRAP-4) Revoked In Delhi As Air Quality Improves

Publication Date: Recent Source: Local News

The stringent anti-pollution measure GRAP-4 has been revoked in Delhi as the air quality continues to improve. The air quality index (AQI) has seen a significant dip, prompting the sub-committee to lift the restrictions.

  • The AQI was recorded at 364, which is categorized as 'very poor' but is 36 points below the thresholds for Stage-4 measures.
  • Stage-4 measures were reimposed on December 16 due to rising pollution levels.
  • The AQI is expected to remain in the 'very poor' category in the coming days, influenced by favorable weather conditions.
  • Measures previously included a ban on construction activities and restrictions on non-essential trucks and school classes.
"The AQI is likely to remain in ‘very poor’ category in the coming days due to favourable meteorological conditions."

In conclusion, the lifting of GRAP-4 measures reflects improvements in Delhi's air quality, though caution remains as conditions could shift.

item.title: American Airlines, World's Largest, Grounds All US Flights On Christmas Eve - NDTV
item.description:
American Airlines Grounds All US Flights on Christmas Eve Due to Technical Glitch

Date: December 24, 2024 Source: Reuters

On Christmas Eve, American Airlines, the world's largest airline carrier, grounded all its flights in the United States due to a technical glitch. This disruption occurs during one of the busiest travel times of the year.

  • American Airlines faced a technical glitch leading to the grounding of all US flights.
  • The airline informed passengers of the situation and promised updates every 15 minutes.
  • Many passengers expressed frustration on social media about the cancellations and inconveniences.
  • Shares of American Airlines fell by 3.8% before market opening.
  • This incident follows a notable Microsoft outage that impacted various industries globally.
“Our teams are working to resolve the issue as quickly as possible, and we apologize to our customers for the inconvenience.” - American Airlines

This incident highlights the vulnerabilities in airline operations during peak travel seasons, raising questions about the reliability of technological systems in critical infrastructure.

item.title: World's most advanced and expensive; Indo-US NISAR satellite to launch soon - Business Standard
item.description:
Indo-US NISAR Satellite Set to Launch in March 2025

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

The world's most advanced and expensive earth observation satellite, NISAR, developed by India and the US, is expected to launch by March 2025 after several delays.

NISAR, designed for precise monitoring of Earth’s ecosystems, will scan land and ice surfaces, aiding in climate change research and disaster management.

  • NISAR stands for NASA-ISRO Synthetic Aperture Radar.
  • The satellite will measure changes in ecosystems, sea ice, and geological activity.
  • It features dual-frequency radar for unprecedented data accuracy.
  • Jointly funded by India and the US with a budget of Rs 5,800 crore.
  • Launched from Satish Dhawan Space Centre in India.
“NISAR will help scientists to better understand the hard outer layer of Earth, its crust.”

The NISAR satellite will significantly contribute to environmental monitoring and disaster response by providing reliable data on global changes.

item.title: ICC Men’s Champions Trophy 2025 schedule announced - ICC Cricket
item.description:
ICC Men’s Champions Trophy 2025 Schedule Announced

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here]Source: [Insert Source Here]

The International Cricket Council (ICC) has announced the fixtures for the ICC Men’s Champions Trophy 2025, set to take place from February 19 to March 9 in Pakistan and the UAE.

  • The tournament will feature 15 matches with eight teams over 19 days.
  • Dubai International Cricket Stadium is confirmed as a neutral venue.
  • Fans can register their interest for tickets here.

The tournament marks the return of the Champions Trophy after its last edition in 2017, with Pakistan hosting the event for the first time since 1996. Group A includes Bangladesh, India, New Zealand, and Pakistan, while Group B comprises Afghanistan, Australia, England, and South Africa.

“The ICC is delighted to release the schedule for the Men’s Champions Trophy 2025... This Champions Trophy is truly poised to be an unmissable celebration of the World Cricket’s finest.” - Jay Shah, ICC Chair

This event not only highlights cricket's competitive spirit but also showcases Pakistan as a host, promising an exciting atmosphere for players and fans alike.

item.title: Will Varun Dhawan’s Baby John just be Vijay’s Theri on steroids, or is there more to it? - The Indian Express
item.description:
Will Varun Dhawan’s Baby John Just Be Vijay’s Theri on Steroids, or Is There More to It?

Publication Date: December 2024, Source: Indian Express

Varun Dhawan’s upcoming film, Baby John, is an official remake of the 2016 Tamil blockbuster Theri, featuring Vijay. Directed by Atlee, Baby John marks Dhawan's first portrayal of a cop and raises expectations for a captivating narrative as it explores themes of familial bonds.

  • Key Connections: The film draws from the emotional core of Theri, emphasizing the father-daughter relationship and the protagonist's dual life as a father and a police officer.
  • Character Dynamics: The movie updates character relationships, including the love story between the cop and his wife, which has evolved since Theri.
  • Casting Choices: Rajpal Yadav's addition is noted as a change from the original, bringing a fresh dynamic to the supporting roles.
  • A Deeper Narrative: While promising more action and drama, the film aims to retain its emotional depth with themes of revenge and justice.
“Baby John, summa Therikka vidunga” (Baby John, let the sparks fly).

This film not only aims to resonate with fans of the original but also seeks to establish Varun Dhawan in a new light as he takes on the iconic role of a police officer. Expectations are set high as the film gears up for a big release this Christmas.

item.title: "Vegetable Knife For Bypass Surgery": Jagdeep Dhankhar On No-Trust Motion - NDTV
item.description:
Vegetable Knife For Bypass Surgery: Jagdeep Dhankhar On No-Trust Motion

Date: New Delhi

In a recent address, Rajya Sabha Chairperson Jagdeep Dhankhar commented on the opposition's failed no-confidence motion against him, using a sharp metaphor to express his views.

  • Dhankhar stated, "Never use a vegetable-cutting knife for bypass surgery" to describe the notice against him.
  • The no-confidence motion was rejected due to procedural faults, including a misspelled name and inadequate notice.
  • He emphasized the importance of free expression in democracy and critiqued the Congress for not allowing full discourse.
  • Opposition members claimed Dhankhar's actions led to disruption in the Upper House, while he described their campaign against him as hurtful.
  • The controversy also touches on larger political frictions involving Sonia Gandhi and George Soros.
“If expression is qualified, compromised, or made subject to coercion, democratic values are flawed. It is antithetical to democratic evolution.”

This incident highlights ongoing tensions in the Indian Parliament and raises questions about the standards of parliamentary procedure and democratic discourse.

item.title: Illegal Bangladeshi immigration: Delhi Police arrest eleven; forged Aadhaar, voter ID cards seized - The Hindu
item.description:
Delhi Police Arrest Gang Involved in Illegal Immigration of Bangladeshi Nationals

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

Delhi Police announced the arrest of 11 individuals linked to a gang involved in the illegal immigration of Bangladeshi citizens. The authorities stated that their investigation led to the capture of both Bangladeshi nationals and those accused of forging documents.

  • 11 individuals arrested, including 4 Bangladeshi citizens.
  • The gang was uncovered during an investigation into a murder case.
  • Authorities recovered numerous fake documents, including ID cards and birth certificates.
  • The gang operated through a fake online document service.
  • Payments for illegal documents were made through Paytm.
“The gang was busted when our team tracked down four people involved in a murder case in Sangam Vihar on October 21.” - Deputy Commissioner of Police Ankit Chauhan

The investigation highlights the ongoing issue of illegal immigration and the methods used to forge documents to facilitate it.

item.title: ‘I am not a Pakistani’, clarifies YouTuber Zara Dar, who quit PhD for OnlyFans - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Zara Dar addresses misinformation about her that had spread since she posted a video stating that she was quitting her PhD for OnlyFans

Date: Dec 24, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

YouTuber Zara Dar, known for quitting her PhD studies to pursue a career on OnlyFans, clarified misinformation regarding her heritage, asserting that she is American and not Pakistani.

  • Dropped out of her PhD to focus on being a full-time content creator on OnlyFans.
  • Clarified that she is of mixed background: American, Persian, Southern European, Middle Eastern, and Indian.
  • Addressed misconceptions regarding her name causing confusion with another influencer.
  • Stated she continues to share educational content on YouTube related to her engineering background.
“With all due respect, I am not Pakistani. I am American, born and raised.”

The event has sparked conversations about identity and the impact of social media on personal narratives.

item.title: ‘Par idhar acting kaun karega?’ Fans compare Sid-Janhvi's Param Sundari first look to Chennai Express, 2 States - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Fans Compare Sid-Janhvi's 'Param Sundari' First Look to Iconic Bollywood Films

Date: Dec 24, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The first look of the upcoming Bollywood film Param Sundari, featuring Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor, has sparked nostalgia among fans while drawing comparisons to classic films like Chennai Express and 2 States. However, reactions to the film's leads have been mixed due to concerns over their acting abilities.

  • Fans feel a sense of nostalgia with the first look, reminiscent of early 2010s Bollywood romcoms.
  • The film is set against the backdrop of the current 'stylish action-core' trend in Bollywood.
  • Comparisons have been made to Shah Rukh Khan and Deepika Padukone’s Chennai Express and Alia Bhatt’s 2 States.
  • Concerns raised about the stereotypical representation of South Indian characters.
  • Produced by Maddock Films and directed by Tushar Jalota, Param Sundari is scheduled for release on July 25, 2025.
“Par idhar acting kaun karega?”

The public’s reaction has suggested skepticism regarding the leads' performances, with comments humorously targeting their acting skills.

In conclusion, while the nostalgic elements of Param Sundari excite some fans, there are considerable concerns about its stereotypical portrayal of characters and the acting abilities of its stars.

item.title: Vinod Kambli's brain declared 'unstable' by doctor: 'There are degenerative changes...' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Vinod Kambli's Brain Condition Causes Concern, Doctor Reports Unstable Health

Date: Dec 24, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Vinod Kambli's health has been declared concerning by his doctor, as his brain condition is reported to be unstable following a recent hospitalization.

  • Kambli admitted to Aakriti Hospital after health deterioration, experiencing high-grade fever and muscle cramps.
  • Doctor's update: expected discharge in 2-3 days, but brain condition remains unstable with degenerative changes.
  • Kambli expressed gratitude towards Sachin Tendulkar for his support amid health challenges.
“His brain's condition is not stable... There are degenerative changes in his brain. So, we are focussing more on rehabilitation.” - Dr. Vivek Dwivedi

Despite his health issues, Kambli remains positive, indicating a hopeful recovery while continuing rehabilitation efforts.

item.title: Manu Bhaker admits lapse on her part while filing Khel Ratna nominations, says 'awards are not my goal' - The Times of India
item.description:
Manu Bhaker admits lapse on her part while filing Khel Ratna nominations, says 'awards are not my goal'

Publication Date: [Date not provided] Source: [Source not provided]

Indian shooter Manu Bhaker has acknowledged a mistake in her application for the Khel Ratna award and stated that winning awards is not her primary objective.

  • Manu Bhaker expressed regret over her oversight in the nomination process.
  • She emphasized that her focus is on performance rather than accolades.
  • Her comments highlight a common sentiment among athletes regarding the pressures of awards and recognition.
“Awards are not my goal,” said Bhaker, reaffirming her commitment to the sport.

In conclusion, Bhaker's perspective offers insight into the mindset of athletes who prioritize competition and personal growth over external validation.

item.title: Boxing Day Test: Will Rohit Sharma and Usman Khawaja, Shubman Gill and Rishabh Pant, finally stand up? - The Indian Express
item.description:
Boxing Day Test: Will Rohit Sharma and Usman Khawaja, Shubman Gill and Rishabh Pant, finally stand up?

Publication Date: December 25, 2023 | Source: Indian Express

As Christmas Eve unfolds in Melbourne, anticipation builds for the Boxing Day Test, a cherished tradition in Australian cricket. With expectations of 90,000 spectators and soaring temperatures, the match signifies not only sportsmanship but the evolving narratives of cricket history in Australia.

  • The Boxing Day Test has become synonymous with cricket culture in Australia, evolving dramatically since its inception.
  • Dr. Thomas Heenan notes the influence of marketing and the need for "instant tradition" in the sport.
  • The game's popularity surged after the 1979 acquisition of TV rights by Kerry Packer, marking a pivotal shift in how cricket was consumed.
  • India's presence in the Australian cricket landscape has grown since the 1983 World Cup, intensifying the competitive spirit.
  • The pitch conditions suggest that fast bowlers will thrive, with significant sideways movement expected.
  • Both teams face challenges with their batting units, particularly under pressure from quality bowling.
“The scoreline is a fair reflection of two below-par batting units who haven’t come to terms with the moving Kookaburra newish ball.”

In conclusion, as the Boxing Day Test draws near, all eyes will be on the batsmen, particularly Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, to perform in a pressure-laden environment and possibly redefine the legacy of their performances in this iconic match.

item.title: 7 longest living deep-sea creatures - DNA India
item.description:
7 Longest Living Deep-Sea Creatures

Date: Dec 24, 2024

Source: DNA

Some of the oldest animals on Earth, famous for their unique lives can be found in the ocean. Here are the 7 water animals that live the longest.

  • Lobster: They can continuously repair their genetic material and slow down the aging process, living for over a century.
  • Tortoise: With a slow metabolism and a robust immune system, they can live for more than 100 years.
  • Bowhead whale: Known for living over 200 years, thanks to its strong immune system and Arctic habitat.
  • Turritopsis dohrnii (immortal jellyfish): Capable of reverting to its polyp stage when stressed, thereby avoiding death.
  • Greenland shark: Renowned for its longevity of up to 400 years, due to its cold-water habitat.
  • Red sea urchin: Lives more than 200 years, with a slow metabolism contributing to its lifespan.
  • Koi fish: Can live anywhere from 25 to 35 years, influenced by genetics and diet.
This information is not DNA's opinion but obtained from media reports.

This article highlights the remarkable longevity of various deep-sea creatures, showcasing the fascinating adaptations that allow them to thrive for decades or even centuries.

item.title: Scan, share, done: WhatsApp update brings in-app scanning for iOS users - details - Mint
item.description:
WhatsApp Introduces In-App Document Scanning for iOS Users

Publication Date: October 2023, Source: Live Mint

WhatsApp has launched an in-app scanning feature for iOS users, enhancing document sharing by allowing users to scan documents directly within the app.

Key Points

  • New in-app scanning feature is available in the latest WhatsApp update (version 24.25.80).
  • This feature allows users to scan documents without external tools.
  • Users can adjust scan margins for better quality.
  • The update is currently being rolled out to a select group of iOS users.
  • The feature aims to streamline document sharing for personal and professional use.
“The ability to scan and send documents directly within the instant messaging app removes the reliance on third-party scanning apps.”

This update is seen as a significant improvement in WhatsApp's document-sharing capabilities, making it a more comprehensive communication tool.

item.title: Vivo Y29 5G launched with 5500 mAh battery and 50 MP AI camera - The Hindu
item.description:
Vivo Y29 5G launched with 5500 mAh battery and 50 MP AI camera

Published on: December 24, 2024 Source: The Hindu

The Vivo Y29 5G smartphone was recently launched, offering significant features including a large battery and advanced camera technology.

  • Powered by Dimensity 6300 platform with four storage options.
  • 6.68-inch LCD display with 1608 × 720 resolution and 120 Hz refresh rate.
  • Equipped with a robust 5500 mAh battery supporting 44W charging.
  • Long video playback of up to 19.7 hours on platforms like YouTube.
  • IP64 rating for dust and water resistance.
  • 50 MP rear camera with AI editing features and an 8 MP front camera.
  • Available in Diamond Black, Glacier Blue, and Titanium Gold colors.
“The battery can maintain 80% health over 4 years, ensuring peak performance and reliability for everyday needs.”

In conclusion, the Vivo Y29 5G promises to be a reliable smartphone with impressive battery life and quality camera features, catering to tech-savvy users.

item.description:
Oppo Reno 13 Series Confirmed for Launch in India

Date: Dec 24, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The Oppo Reno 13 series has been officially confirmed for launch in India. The phones were initially launched in China, and the brand has now teased their arrival.

  • The series includes Oppo Reno 13 and Oppo Reno 13 Pro models.
  • Specifications are likely to match the Chinese versions featuring MediaTek Dimensity 8350 chipset.
  • Expected color options include Ivory White and Luminous Blue for Reno 13, and Graphite Grey and Mist Lavender for Reno 13 Pro.
  • Both phones are expected to have premium builds with an aluminium frame and glass back.
  • Expectations include a 50MP front camera and a dual-camera setup on the Reno 13.
"The teaser featured an animation showcasing the phone, but no further details were provided."

The Oppo Reno 13 series is anticipated to create a buzz once it launches, given its expected high-end features and design.

item.description:
Vivo Y29 5G With 5,500mAh Battery, 44W Fast Charging Launched in India

Publication Date: Tuesday | Source: Gadgets 360

The Vivo Y29 5G smartphone has been launched in India, featuring a robust design, powerful battery, and fast charging capabilities.

  • Backed by a 5,500mAh battery with 44W wired fast charging.
  • IP64-rated build for dust and splash resistance; claims of military-grade durability.
  • Available in multiple RAM and storage configurations: 4GB + 128GB, 6GB + 128GB, and 8GB + 128GB/256GB.
  • Price starts at Rs. 13,999, with cashback offers available.

“The cushioning structure acts as drop-resistant armour.” - Vivo

The Vivo Y29 5G is positioned as a mid-range smartphone catering to durability and performance, now available for Indian consumers.

item.title: Congress files plea in Supreme Court against amendments to election rules - The Hindu
item.description:
Congress Challenges Changes to Election Rules in Supreme Court

Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

The Congress party has filed a plea in the Supreme Court against recent amendments to the Conduct of Election Rules, claiming they infringe on citizens’ access to election-related records.

  • Amendments to Rule 93 of the Conduct of Election Rules of 1961 limit public access to CCTV footage and video recordings from polling stations.
  • The amendment was implemented on December 20, 2024, by the Ministry of Law and Justice.
  • Citing the need to protect the electoral process, officials argued these changes were essential to prevent misinformation.
  • Jairam Ramesh emphasized the importance of public consultation and transparency in elections.
“The integrity of the electoral process is fast eroding. Hopefully the Supreme Court will help restore it,” said Jairam Ramesh.

The Congress aims to uphold transparency in the electoral process through this legal challenge.

item.title: Shyam Benegal funeral: Naseeruddin Shah bids emotional goodbye to filmmaker, Gulzar pays last respects - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Shyam Benegal funeral: Naseeruddin Shah bids emotional goodbye to filmmaker, Gulzar pays last respects

Date: December 24, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Shyam Benegal, a pioneer of Indian parallel cinema, passed away at the age of 90 on December 23, 2024. His death was confirmed by his daughter, Pia Benegal. The funeral is scheduled for December 24 at Shivaji Park Electric Crematorium in Mumbai.

  • Shabana Azmi confirmed the funeral details via her Instagram.
  • The funeral is set to begin at 2 PM, attended by many Bollywood celebrities.
  • Naseeruddin Shah was seen emotionally bidding farewell at the funeral.
  • Known for his significant contributions to Indian cinema, Benegal had a career marked by social commentary and realism.
  • He celebrated his 90th birthday just days before his passing.
“His films were marked by a degree of realism and social commentary, and helped in Indian parallel cinema movement in the 1970s and 1980s.”

Shyam Benegal's legacy will be remembered for his impactful storytelling in Indian cinema, and his passing marks a significant loss for the film industry.

item.title: Oppo Reno 13 5G Series Global Launch Teased; Design, Colourway, Build Details Revealed - Gadgets 360
item.description:
Oppo Reno 13 5G Series Global Launch Teased; Colourway, Build Details Revealed

Date: October 2023
Source: Gadgets 360

The Oppo Reno 13 5G series is set to launch globally soon, with confirmed colour options and build details. The lineup will feature AI-backed functionalities and a robust design.

  • Launch confirmed for global markets outside China.
  • IP69 ratings for dust and water resistance.
  • AI features like AI Livephoto and AI Editor included.
  • Butterfly Shadow Design with a unique back panel pattern.
  • Equipped with MediaTek Dimensity 8350 SoCs.
  • 50-megapixel dual rear camera and 50-megapixel selfie camera on all models.
  • Support for fast charging with 5,600mAh and 5,800mAh batteries respectively.
The global versions will come with "all-round armour" protection.

As the launch date approaches, the phones are anticipated to mirror their Chinese counterparts in features and specifications.
